newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysian palm oil marginally up ahead of data.
newsitem.headline: Malaysian palm oil marginally up ahead of data.

text.p: Malaysian palm oil prices were marginally higher at midday after some profit-taking emerged towards the morning close to erase earlier gains.
Traders said there were some speculative buying when third month September futures hit the psychological level of 1,200.

"If the first 20 days of June exports remain within market expectation, the price (September futures) will fluctuate between 1,190 and 1,200 ringgit levels," a technical analyst said. "We will see rangebound trading. Prices will not either collapse or shoot up sharply as players are taking a more cautious stance ahead of weekend."
At midday close, the contract was only up one ringgit at 1,195 ringgit ($475.53) a tonne.
Cargo surveyor, SGS (M) Sdn Bhd is releasing the June 1-20 export data in early afternoon to provide the market a clear path, traders said.
Morning dealing was volatile and turnover was 1,082 lots.
Physical June (south) crude palm oil offered at 1,235 ringgit against bids of 1,230 after trading at 1,230 and 1,227.50 and June (central) 1,220 against 1,215.
